From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle High German schuolære, from Old High German scuolāri, from Medieval Latin scholaris; analyzable as Schule +‎ -er.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈʃyːlɐ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Schüler m (strong, genitive Schülers, plural Schüler, feminine Schülerin)

  1. (school) pupil, student, schoolboy (male or of unspecified gender)
  2. disciple (male or of unspecified gender)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Schüler [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Schüler die Schüler
genitive eines des Schülers der Schüler
dative einem dem Schüler den Schülern
accusative einen den Schüler die Schüler
